intro: Alaticaulia listroglossa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed alaticaulia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. Native to the mountainous regions of South America, it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
